oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Analysis of short videos of bovine embryos can detect presence of cryodamage
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Killingsworth, R.
Hayden, C.
Hickerson, S.
Webb, J.
Wiik, A.
Gibbons, J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cryopreservation of bovine embryos has transformed animal breeding strategies by allowing storage of genetic material which enables efficient recipient utilization, sale and market足ing of embryos, and shipping and transport of embryos around the world. Advancements have been made in cryopreserva足tion techniques including the introduction of direct transfer ethylene glycol media, controlled rate freezers allowing pre足cise temperature control of the freezing curve and vitrifica足tion techniques. However, little advancement has been made to evaluate embryo survival of cryopreservation which results in the transfer of embryos which have suffered cryodamage and have no chance of establishing a pregnancy. The objective of this study was to use graphic image processing (GIP) and machine-learning (ML) techniques to evaluate embryo health post-cryopreservation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 56 (2023): 2023 Annual Conference Proceedings ; 221
